steps.text: Identify potential risks in working machines.
Evaluate fire risk based on machine's operating environment.
Consider potential impact of a fire due to operating conditions and environment.
Shut down engine before inspecting for fuel leaks.
Check joints of hoses and pipes for fuel leaks.
Inspect electrical systems at least once a year.
Document inspections of electrical systems.
Service electrical systems daily on electric-powered and hybrid machines.
Use a multimeter to measure voltage drops in electrical systems.
Inspect alternators, cables, and earthing points with a thermal imaging camera.
Check main power switch location and operation.
Repair any malfunctions in electrical systems or components.
Check cables not protected by a fuse several times a year.
Replace damaged or worn-out cables.
Check electric panel during maintenance.
Repair any redundant or hanging wires in the electric panel.
Ensure fuse boxes are intact and have lids.
Check cable harnesses and attach them firmly.
Tighten and cover cable connections.
Protect cables in high-vibration engine compartment with fastening brackets no more than 150 mm apart.
Fasteners and cable ties should withstand temperatures of 120°C.
Do not attach cables to pipes or hoses containing flammable material.
Firmly attach alternator with correct belt tension and terminal covers.
Keep alternator filter clean to prevent overheating.
Check for anomalies with a thermal camera.
Inspect exhaust pipe for leaks and ensure all thermal shields are in place.
Prevent contamination during refuelling of urea systems and diesel particulate filter.
Ensure regeneration occurs in a safe outdoor environment away from flammable materials.
Delay regeneration if machine is in a fire-hazard environment.
Do not leave machine unattended during regeneration.
Inspect all hoses in the machine, including those in swivelling joints.
Check engine compartment has at least 3L extinguishing agent per cubic meter.
Install detection system covering entire engine compartment.
Connect detection system to non-fused cables.
Obtain certificate for installation.
Confirm system operation at start-up.
Repair any malfunctions by authorized shop.
Service system at least once a year.
Clean engine compartments daily.
Shut down engine in case of fire.
Cut electricity from main power switch.
Call for help.
Perform first-aid fire extinguishing.
Confirm fire is out with fire department.
Report all accidents and dangerous situations to a supervisor immediately.
Stop and leave the machine in place if possible.
Prevent further damage and minimize injuries.
Wear protective clothing and a helmet.
Use a hands-free device for phone calls.
Wear a safety belt.
Use stepladders and handrails, maintaining three points of contact when climbing.
Keep doors closed during operation.
Ensure tools are secure and emergency exits are marked.
Repair any malfunctions that could lead to an accident without delay.
Arrange practical training on accident and fire procedures.

constraints.text: Working machines must be evaluated for fire risks considering their operating environment.
Fuel leaks require engine shutdown before inspection.
Electrical systems need annual inspections and daily servicing.
Check cables not protected by a fuse several times a year.
Engine compartments must have at least 3L extinguishing agent per cubic meter.
Detection system must cover entire engine compartment and be connected to non-fused cables.
System operation must be confirmed at start-up and any malfunctions repaired.
System must be serviced at least once a year.
Engine compartments must be cleaned daily.
Report all accidents and dangerous situations to a supervisor immediately.
Stop and leave the machine in place if possible.
